reviewText:
John Steinbeck would be proud with this version, It is truly long 53 episodes but worth many sleepless nights. Every actor fits his or her characters. Your going to cry, laugh and just feel what your suppose to feel for the characters.

Actually for me the actress that played Rebecca stole the cake and show for me her laugh was absolutely contagiously evil.

The story has a lot of twist, very interesting and you cannot help yourself but to watch it non stop.  It taught us not to give up easily when we hit the bottom, just continue to love life even though we reached the point of giving up.

For the best audio and video quality with the original broadcast English subtitles, look for 'Studio: MBC America' under Product Details. MBC America is the licensed US distributor for East of Eden. MBC America works from the original MBC-TV master recordings and hires professional translators for the broadcast subtitles, which are also used for the DVD release. Each episode runs about 60 minutes. Volume 1 contains Episodes 1-25; East of Eden Vol. 2 contains Episodes 26-56 and special features. D. Bannon was the subtitler for the MBC America broadcast and DVD release of East of Eden Vol. 2. He discusses subtitling episodes 33-56 of East of Eden in The Elements of Subtitles: A Practical Guide to the Art of Dialogue, Character, Context, Tone and Style in Subtitling.
